summary: This is an email from PEOPLE magazine reporter Elaine Aradillas to a U.S. Attorney's Office contact, inquiring about the legal viability of sexual abuse allegations against Prince Andrew and the status of SDNY investigations into Ghislaine Maxwell and other associates of Jeffrey Epstein. It references an upcoming BBC interview with Prince Andrew.

persons.name: Elaine Aradillas
persons.context: Staff writer for PEOPLE magazine who sent the email inquiry to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding Prince Andrew and Epstein case investigations.

persons.name: Nicholas Biase
persons.context: Recipient of the email inquiry from the reporter at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS).

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: British royal whose relationship with Jeffrey Epstein and sexual abuse allegations from 2001 are the subject of the reporter's legal questions. An interview with him is set to be released by the BBC.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier and convicted sex offender; the inquiry concerns allegations against his associate, Prince Andrew.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Epstein's longtime associate; the reporter asks if the SDNY is currently investigating her.

connections.description: The document references Prince Andrew discussing his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein in an upcoming BBC interview.
Maxwell is described as a woman associated with Epstein, and the reporter asks if she is under investigation.
Reporter Aradillas is sending a professional inquiry to Biase, a contact at the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: BBC Prince Andrew Interview Release
events.description: The BBC is scheduled to release an interview with Prince Andrew where he discusses his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Alleged Abuse by Prince Andrew
events.description: Two women allege they were sexually abused or molested by Prince Andrew in New York and the U.S. Virgin Islands.

events.title: Florida Civil Case Ruling
events.description: A civil case in Florida struck down allegations against Prince Andrew as 'Immaterial and impertinent'.

keyFacts: A reporter is seeking legal clarification on whether sexual abuse allegations from 2001 against Prince Andrew can be prosecuted in New York, given a prior Florida civil ruling.

The inquiry references specific allegations: one woman states she was forced to have sex with Prince Andrew three times in New York and the U.S. Virgin Islands; another says she was molested by him in New York.

The reporter asks if the Child Victim's Act could allow charges to be brought and if the SDNY is investigating cases related to the allegations, Ghislaine Maxwell, or other women associated with Epstein.
The timing of the inquiry is linked to an imminent BBC interview where Prince Andrew discusses his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.
